intro: Eriope crassipes subsp. cristalinae, commonly known as the crystalline eriope, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its subspecies status reflects subtle morphological differences from the main species, particularly in leaf and flower structure. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturalists alike.
